column3: Please squash your changes, and remove any @ mentions from commit messages.
utACK a94e470\n\nPlease keep your commit messages more specific in future. i.e `docs: textual improvements in translation_strings_policy.md`.
"E.g." should be followed by a comma (as we use American English for docs).\nRef: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Latin_phrases_(E)#e.g.
Same here.\nAlso the first letter should be capitalized after a full stop, right?
